<<<<<<< HEAD
Objections to Mr. Lowndes's proposal about the amendment of our coin·
[2], 11, 13-14, [1] p.
printed by Tho. Hodgkin, and are to be sold by John Whitlock, in Stationer's Court, near Amen-Corner, London : 1695.
The text and register are continuous, despite the pagination. A reply to William Lowndes's 'A report containing an essay for the amendment of the silver coins', London, 1695. Marginal notes. Reproduction of the original at the Glasgow University Library.
=======

The text and register are continuous, despite the pagination. A reply to William Lowndes's 'A report containing an essay for the amendment of the silver coins', London, 1695. Marginal notes. Reproduction of the original at the Glasgow University Library.

Stationer's Court, near Amen-Corner
